intro: Diclidium conglobatum, commonly known as the globe sphaerocarp, is a species of liverwort that belongs to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its dense, globular structures that resemble small spheres. Its leaves are closely arranged and often covered in a thick layer of paraphylls, which help protect it from desiccation. Diclidium conglobatum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
